title: Bodegas Faustino 2013 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Prune and cassis aromas are timid and earthy. This crianza from a cool, rainy year feels choppy, but has substance. Spicy, peppery red-fruit flavors are dry and finish with acidic freshness.

title: Château Troussas 2015  Médoc
description: Weighed down with wood and spice, this wine only redeems itself because of the weight of the blackberry and black-currant fruit. These give the wine richness and density, allowing room for juicy fruits to come through the wood flavors. Drink from 2022 to allow the wood to die back.

title: Cantele 2016 Chardonnay (Salento)
description: This wine is straightforward in its ripe melon and citrus aromas, which carry to the lightly concentrated palate. There's something enjoyable about its simple, fruit-driven nature that makes it an easy wine to sip on.

title: Castel Faglia NV Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas reminiscent of a struck match and a whiff of medicinal herb lead the nose. The palate is on the lean side, offering yellow-apple skin, lemon zest and a taste of bitter walnut alongside continuous lively bubbles.

title: Giancarlo Ceci 2015 Parco Grande Red (Castel del Monte)
description: Predominately Uva di Troia, with additions of Aglianico and Montepulciano, this blend shows aromas of peanut skins over crushed bramble berries and violets. The palate is light in feel, tart berries are zesty and bolstered by drying, grippy tannins. Racy acidity cuts this short but makes it a food-friendly wine.

title: J & J NV 4 Boys 4th Release Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this has aromas that bring notes of black licorice and cherry, along with light oxidative notes. It's a shame, as good things are happening on the palate.

title: Layer Cake 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Slightly reductive aromas of wet clay and sour olive meet with dark cranberry fruit and camphor on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart with raspberry and orange rind and gains complexity from the forest moss and wet wood flavors.

title: Markko 2012 Select Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Ohio)
description: Savory aromas of baked raspberry, cranberry and vanilla are somewhat foxy. Flavors of raspberry and pomegranate are nearing overripe, with layers of pepper and grippy tannins that offer some much needed structure. The finish is all tannin and spice.

title: Melrose 2015 Merlot (Umpqua Valley)
description: Merlot seems to struggle a bit in Oregon, lacking the volume of other West Coast versions. Quite tart with simple berry flavors, this wine shows no real flesh, but goes directly from a sappy start into a tangy finish.

title: Pagos del Rey 2013 Castillo de Albai Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Subtle aromas of cherry cola are basic. This Rioja is medium in body, with slightly scratchy tannins and acidity. Earthy plum and berry flavors finish with a hint of toasty oak and a sense of dryness.

title: Peter Mertes 2016 Platinum Dream Stone Liebfraumilch White (Rheinhessen)
description: While the nose is earthen and mineral, the palate of this light-bodied blend of Silvaner and Riesling offers pleasant lemon and green melon refreshment. It's a juicy, uncomplicated sip, with subtle sweetness and a brisk finish. Drink now.

title: Ricci Curbastro 2007 Museum Release Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Subdued aromas suggesting toasted oak, bread crust and walnut carry over to lean, evolved palate along with bitter yellow apple skin, mature orange rind and coffee. A lively perlage lends vibrancy.

title: Santa Sofia 2016  Lugana
description: Aromas of exotic fruit and citrus lead the nose on this soft white. The aromas follow over to the round simple palate along with banana.

title: Sunset Hills 2015 Shenandoah Springs Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)
description: Red- and black-plum aromas dominate the nose, with layers of coffee, kirsch and geranium in the background. A coffee tone starts off on the palate, moving to cranberry, grape and plum flavors. Zippy acidity matches the full body to create a nice balance.

title: The Four Graces 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: It's not apparent what's going on with this wine, which tastes disjointed and aggressively stemmy. Its fruit is thin and generic, plain red berries, with a whiff of compost. But the impact of stems (whole clusters?) is what dominates. Two bottles tasted with equal results.

title: Twin Cedars 2014 Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Aromas are light and dominated by barrel notes, including vanilla and coconut. The black-fruit flavors are sweet and rich, showing quite a bit of warmth. It doesn't all add up.

title: Villa 2013 Boké Noir Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)
description: You'll find sensations of bread crust, apple, cherry, medicinal herb, citrus and nut on this lively sparkler. Despite being a Pas Dosé, it has a somewhat candied note on the finish.

title: Rare 2014 Rare Black Blend Red (California)
description: A good blast of black cherry and cedar in the aroma is followed by rich, grapey flavors on a moderately firm texture. It is softened by a hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: Château la Mouline 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: A soft, ripe wine, this shows plenty of red-berry flavors and acidity. It is open and fruity, with a crisp edge that freshens the wine. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Myon de l'Enclos 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: This wine comes from a small 12-acre vineyard. Black-currant fruits and firm tannins keep the wine structured while maintaining a crisp character. The wine is simple, fruity and will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Airlie 2014 Vintner's Blend Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Despite the excellent vintage this is just barely ripe, with green notes among generic red fruits. Tannins are stiff, and a hint of butter runs through the finish. Nothing really jells.

title: Black Pearl 2015 The Mischief Maker Shiraz-Mourvèdre (Coastal Region)
description: This blend of 79% Shiraz and 21% Mourvèdre is dense and concentrated, with deep notes of all-fruit preserves, raspberry sauce and licorice. The palate offers more decadence in waves of fudgy brownie and candied cherry, while the thick and chewy tannins lend some serious grip and a firm texture. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2014 Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: Mild fruit aromas are crowded by peanut and burnt-wood notes. This Viura-led blend is full and round on the palate, with forceful flavors of nutty stone fruits, sea brine and wood resin. A lean, acidic palate is better in feel than weak flavors.
designation: Cueva del Monge Fermentado en Barrica

title: Château Brondelle 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 85–87. Barrel Sample. Juicy lively fruitiness, this wine has a stalky edge. It is likely to remain crisp while filling out as the wood aging kicks in.

title: Airlie 2015 Müller-Thurgau (Willamette Valley)
description: At just 10% alcohol and 22 g/l residual sugar, you might expect a fruity wine with a fair amount of sweetness, which indeed is what you get. Simple fruit flavors of apple and melon come with a slightly granular sugary finish.

title: Felline 2015  Primitivo di Manduria
description: Saucy plum and cherry syrup aromas turn brighter and cleaner on the medium-bodied palate. A bit of sweet spice kicks in on the midpalate, but ultimately this is primary, soft in feel and straightforward.

title: Giancarlo Ceci 2016 Panascio Bombino Bianco (Castel del Monte)
description: Canned peas taking center stage over grapefruit and white flowers in an interesting mix of aromas. There's decent weight to the palate, with bright acidity to boot, yet the flavors are subdued and focus on the citrus and herbal elements.

title: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Signature Series Viognier (Monticello)
description: This wine shows mealy apple, margarine and nut aromas on the nose. The flavors are similar yet the mouthfeel is easy-going and pleasing.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Dornfelder (Rheinhessen)
description: Sweet-tart red cherry and berry flavors are plump and juicy in this fresh, easy drinking Dornfelder. It's not a complicated wine but balanced in sweetness and acidity. Drink now.

title: Rosemont 2015 Merlot (Virginia)
description: This Merlot shows aromas and flavors of bright cherry, red plum and baking spices. The fruit comes off as tart on the palate but the oak spices are appealing. Not much tannic expression but a nice acidic lift keeps the finish going strong.
